## Description {#details}

Base struct for all &quot;concrete attribute&quot; deductions.

The abstract attribute is a minimal interface that allows the <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributor">Attributor</a> to orchestrate the abstract/fixpoint analysis. The design allows to hide away implementation choices made for the subclasses but also to structure their implementation and simplify the use of other abstract attributes in-flight.

To allow easy creation of new attributes, most methods have default implementations. The ones that do not are generally straight forward, except <code><a href="#adae4d3d2e4be96b506c572fcc4a8738a">AbstractAttribute::updateImpl</a></code> which is the location of most reasoning associated with the abstract attribute. The update is invoked by the <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributor">Attributor</a> in case the situation used to justify the current optimistic state might have changed. The <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributor">Attributor</a> determines this automatically by monitoring the <code><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributor/#a4f07dfd5d71c602655995567fe27d4a7">Attributor::getAAFor</a></code> calls made by abstract attributes.

The <code>updateImpl</code> method should inspect the IR and other abstract attributes in-flight to justify the best possible (=optimistic) state. The actual implementation is, similar to the underlying abstract state encoding, not exposed. In the most common case, the <code>updateImpl</code> will go through a list of reasons why its optimistic state is valid given the current information. If any combination of them holds and is sufficient to justify the current optimistic state, the method shall return UNCHAGED. If not, the optimistic state is adjusted to the situation and the method shall return CHANGED.

If the manifestation of the &quot;concrete attribute&quot; deduced by the subclass differs from the &quot;default&quot; behavior, which is a (set of) LLVM-IR attribute(s) for an argument, call site argument, function return value, or function, the <code><a href="#a1405b111f812f19e71bbe4286484ef54">AbstractAttribute::manifest</a></code> method should be overloaded.

NOTE: If the state obtained via <a href="#a5f3c26aaee1ca991435953c032b3fd08">getState()</a> is INVALID, thus if <a href="#a5f3c26aaee1ca991435953c032b3fd08">AbstractAttribute::getState()</a>.isValidState() returns false, no information provided by the methods of this class should be used. NOTE: The <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributor">Attributor</a> currently has certain limitations to what we can do. As a general rule of thumb, &quot;concrete&quot; abstract attributes should <em>for now</em> only perform &quot;backward&quot; information propagation. That means optimistic information obtained through abstract attributes should only be used at positions that precede the origin of the information with regards to the program flow. More practically, information can <em>now</em> be propagated from instructions to their enclosing function, but <em>not</em> from call sites to the called function. The mechanisms to allow both directions will be added in the future. NOTE: The mechanics of adding a new &quot;concrete&quot; abstract attribute are described in the file comment.

Definition at line 3293 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/attributor-h">Attributor.h</a>.

### initialize() {#a63f1f9078e9f43f6ac08ac9e1e9b4a41}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual void llvm::AbstractAttribute::initialize (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributor">Attributor</a> &amp; A)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Initialize the state with the information in the <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributor">Attributor</a> <code>A</code>.

This function is called by the <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributor">Attributor</a> once all abstract attributes have been identified. It can and shall be used for task like:
<ul>
<li>identify existing knowledge in the IR and use it for the &quot;known state&quot;</li>
<li>perform any work that is not going to change over time, e.g., determine a subset of the IR, or attributes in-flight, that have to be looked at in the <code>updateImpl</code> method.</li>
</ul>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/attributor-h/#l03357">3357</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/attributor-h">Attributor.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### isQueryAA() {#acbb5972050711bdc2fa4a18ec8f49802}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="virtual bool llvm::AbstractAttribute::isQueryAA () const"
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
A query <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/aa">AA</a> is always scheduled as long as we do updates because it does lazy computation that cannot be determined to be done from the outside.

However, while query AAs will not be fixed if they do not have outstanding dependences, we will only schedule them like other AAs. If a query <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/aa">AA</a> that received a new query it needs to request an update via <code>Attributor::requestUpdateForAA</code>.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/attributor-h/#l03365">3365</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/attributor-h">Attributor.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

## Protected Member Functions

### manifest() {#a1405b111f812f19e71bbe4286484ef54}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual ChangeStatus llvm::AbstractAttribute::manifest (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributor">Attributor</a> &amp; A)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "protected", "virtual"]}>
Hook for the <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributor">Attributor</a> to trigger the manifestation of the information represented by the abstract attribute in the LLVM-IR.

\\Return CHANGED if the IR was altered, otherwise UNCHANGED.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/attributor-h/#l03408">3408</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/attributor-h">Attributor.h</a>.

### trackStatistics() {#add85e4d78cefc67429904d7492aff9a4}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="virtual void llvm::AbstractAttribute::trackStatistics () const"
  labels = {["protected"]}>
Hook to enable custom statistic tracking, called after manifest that resulted in a change if statistics are enabled.

We require subclasses to provide an implementation so we remember to add statistics for them.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/attributor-h/#l03417">3417</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/attributor-h">Attributor.h</a>.

### update() {#a03972b18e36635ccda4c5a26891f0d25}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ChangeStatus AbstractAttribute::update (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributor">Attributor</a> &amp; A)</>}
  labels = {["protected"]}>
Hook for the <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributor">Attributor</a> to trigger an update of the internal state.

If this attribute is already fixed, this method will return UNCHANGED, otherwise it delegates to <code><a href="#adae4d3d2e4be96b506c572fcc4a8738a">AbstractAttribute::updateImpl</a></code>.

\\Return CHANGED if the internal state changed, otherwise UNCHANGED.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/attributor-h/#l03402">3402</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/attributor-h">Attributor.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/ipo/attributor-cpp/#l01049">1049</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/ipo/attributor-cpp">Attributor.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### updateImpl() {#adae4d3d2e4be96b506c572fcc4a8738a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual ChangeStatus llvm::AbstractAttribute::updateImpl (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributor">Attributor</a> &amp; A)</>}
  labels = {["protected"]}>
The actual update/transfer function which has to be implemented by the derived classes.

If it is called, the environment has changed and we have to determine if the current information is still valid or adjust it otherwise.

\\Return CHANGED if the internal state changed, otherwise UNCHANGED.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/attributor-h/#l03426">3426</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/attributor-h">Attributor.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

## Public Static Functions

### classof() {#a31a0cab075117e825acb2b439efbc8bb}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static bool llvm::AbstractAttribute::classof (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/aadepgraphnode">AADepGraphNode</a> &#42; DGN)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "static"]}>
This function is used to identify if an <code>DGN</code> is of type <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractattribute">AbstractAttribute</a> so that the dyn&#95;cast and cast can use such information to cast an <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/aadepgraphnode">AADepGraphNode</a> to an <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractattribute">AbstractAttribute</a>.

We eagerly return true here because all AADepGraphNodes except for the Synthethis <a href="/docs/api/classes/node">Node</a> are of type <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractattribute">AbstractAttribute</a>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/attributor-h/#l03310">3310</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/attributor-h">Attributor.h</a>.

### requiresCalleeForCallBase() {#a42f6982d76a1141138c99c4e1b989ba0}

Return true if this <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/aa">AA</a> requires a &quot;callee&quot; (or an associted function) for a call site positon.
